channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2023071182
item.description:
Report X-2023071182

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager on old unload called QA to door 23 for a leaking flammable hazmat. QA reacted to the call with a hazmat tote, hazmat bag, gloves, towels and mask and brought it to QA area. DescribePack: when inspected found that the cause of the leakage was a loose cap on the hazmat. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA reacted to the call with a hazmat tote, hazmat bag, gloves, towels and mask and brought it to QA area.

item.title: Report E-2023070867
item.description:
Report E-2023070867

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The Binghamton NY facility received a trailer with a release of profile 60-2605 (Press Wash Solvent and Inks) from Amcor Flexibles North America. The flammable liquid waste material that leaked from drums. One drum was overpacked with leaks around the top lid seals (red drum picture). Site personnel replaced the lid seal but identified damage around the lid area and drum was overpacked. The main leaking drum that coated the trailer in blue was identified with a small pin hole on bottom chime. Assumed to be from a puncture. Furthermore, a few other issues were also identified. The lid closure rings for a few drums appeared to be missing nuts to property seal the lids and the outside condition of the drums was extremely poor. The paint on the outside of the drums is causing issues with identifying the remaining leaking drum(s). The customer was contacted to address the closure and condition of the containers offered for shipment.

item.title: Report X-2023071017
item.description:
Report X-2023071017

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged on the drivers truck. Package was given to QA for an inspection and QA was told that that the driver went to deliver the package and noticed the package was leaking around 1:30pm. DescribePack: When QA inspected the package it was found that the caps were loose/off and the item completely leaked out. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a damaged hazmat bucket

item.title: Report X-2023071005
item.description:
Report X-2023071005

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE OF EVENTS IS UNKNOWN. DescribePack: THIS PKG CONTAINS FOUR PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF DISINFECTANT SOLUTION. UNFORTUNATELY, THIS PACKAGE BECAME DAMAGED WHILE IN TRANSIT. ALL OF THE CONTAINERS HAVE NO SEALS AND LOOSE CAPS. AS A RESULT, SOME OF THE LIQUID HAS LEAKED OUT OF THE CONTAINERS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PKG WAS PLACED IN A LARGE PLASTIC BAG AND PLACED IN OUR DAMAGED HAZMAT AREA.

DescribePack: THE LOCATION OF THE LEAKAGE WAS BY THE TOP OF THE BOTTLE . DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PUT INSIDE OF A PLASTIC HAZMAT BAG

Report X-2023070007

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO RESPOND TO A SPILL IN BAY 13 OF THE PRIMARY. RESPONDER WAS SHOWN A PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING. REPONDER WEARING FULL PPE INCLUDING APRON AND GLOVES PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INSIDE A LINED SPILL TRAY. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO DMP PROCESSING AREA AND PROCESSED.
